techmeme.title: OpenAI hires former White House official Aaron "Ronnie" Chatterji as its first chief economist to research how AI will impact economic growth and job creation (Cade Metz/New York Times)
Socket, which provides tools to help detect open source code vulnerabilities, raised a $40M Series B led by Abstract Ventures, taking its total funding to $65M (David Prosser/Forbes)
Document: Arm is canceling a license that let Qualcomm use Arm's intellectual property to design chips, escalating the legal dispute between the companies (Ian King/Bloomberg)
Runway rolls out Act-One, a Gen-3 Alpha tool for animating AI-generated characters with realistic facial expressions using video and voice recordings as inputs (Runway)
Google rolls out enhanced scam detection to Google Messages beta users and previews other safety features, like an option to blur images that may contain nudity (Abner Li/9to5Google)
